intro: Psacalium laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered psacalium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly serrated edge. Psacalium laxiflorum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
